10-Year Limited Warranty

Every Lemon Banjo is built by hand in Glenville, West Virginia, and I stand behind my work. This page explains what is covered under the Lemon Banjos 10-year limited warranty, what is not covered, and how to request service if you ever need it.

What This Warranty Covers

This warranty covers defects in my workmanship for a period of ten (10) years from the original date of purchase. It applies to all Lemon Banjos models in the Oldtime Series, Legacy Series, Master Series, and Custom Series.

Examples of workmanship defects include:

  • Neck construction issues (glue joints, fretboard adhesion, neck heel fit, truss-rod channel issues)
  • Rim construction problems (glue joints, delamination, structural wood defects)
  • Inlays lifting or failing due to improper adhesion
  • Binding separation caused by improper installation
  • Finish problems that clearly result from improper application

If a covered workmanship defect appears during the warranty period, I will—at my discretion—repair the instrument at no charge using new or repaired parts.

What This Warranty Does Not Cover

This warranty does not cover:

Normal wear, setup, and subjective factors

  • Tone, volume, or personal setup preferences
  • String height, bridge selection, head tension, or action adjustments
  • Normal fret wear
  • Worn, scratched, or dulled finishes from everyday play
  • Tarnishing, patina, or aging of metal hardware

Damage from misuse or environment

  • Drops, impacts, or improper handling
  • Exposure to high or low humidity, heat, cold, or rapid climate changes
  • Improper storage or transport
  • Water damage, mold, corrosion, or other environmental issues

Hardware and components not made by me

Many components on a banjo come from reputable outside manufacturers. These parts are not covered under the Lemon Banjos warranty, including (but not limited to):

  • Tuning machines
  • Tension hoop, hooks, and nuts
  • Flange and tone ring
  • Armrest and tailpiece
  • Coordinator rods and resonator hardware
  • Banjo head and bridge
  • Truss rod hardware (if purchased rather than custom-made)

While the parts themselves aren’t covered, I’m usually happy to help recommend or install a replacement if something goes wrong.

Modifications or unauthorized repairs

  • Any repair, modification, or alteration performed by someone else
  • Damage caused by improper repair or incorrect setup by a third party

Any of the above may void the warranty if they affect the structure or stability of the instrument.

Warranty Term

  • The warranty period is 10 years from the original purchase date.
  • The warranty applies to the original owner.
  • The warranty does not automatically transfer if the banjo is sold. A second owner must contact me to discuss re-registering and any remaining coverage.

What I Will Do

For a valid workmanship defect, I will repair the instrument at no charge for labor and for any parts I manufacture.

In most cases, the customer is responsible for safe packing and shipping the instrument to Lemon Banjos. I will cover return shipping back to you once the repair is complete, unless we agree otherwise.

How to Request Warranty Service

If you believe you have a warranty issue, please email me:

Hunter Lemon
Email: hunter@lemonbanjos.com
Phone: (304) 266-0476

Include the following in your email:

  • Your name and contact information
  • The model and (if applicable) serial number
  • Date and place of purchase
  • A clear description of the issue
  • Several clear, well-lit photos of the affected area

Once I review the information, I’ll let you know the next steps and whether the issue appears to fall under this warranty.

This Limited Warranty gives you specific legal rights. You may also have other rights depending on your state or country. If you’re ever unsure about coverage, please feel free to contact me.
